verses.text_plain: Then Job answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then Job answered and said,

verses.text_plain: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.
verses.verse_html:
2I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all. ▼
▼ miserable: or, troublesome

verses.text_plain: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
verses.verse_html:
3Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest? ▼
▼ vain…: Heb. words of wind

footnotes.body_html: ▼ vain…: Heb. words of wind

verses.text_plain: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.
verses.verse_html: 4I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.

verses.text_plain: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.
verses.verse_html: 5But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.

verses.text_plain: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?
verses.verse_html:
6Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased? ▼
▼ what…: Heb. what goeth from me?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ what…: Heb. what goeth from me?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ what…: Heb. what goeth from me?

verses.text_plain: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
verses.verse_html: 7But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.

tokens.text: But now he hath made me weary

verses.text_plain: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.
verses.verse_html: 8And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.

tokens.text: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles

verses.text_plain: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
verses.verse_html: 9He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

verses.text_plain: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
verses.verse_html: 10They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

verses.text_plain: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
verses.verse_html:
11God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked. ▼
▼ hath…: Heb. hath shut me up

footnotes.body_text: ▼ hath…: Heb. hath shut me up
footnotes.body_html: ▼ hath…: Heb. hath shut me up

verses.text_plain: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
verses.verse_html: 12I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

tokens.text: but he hath broken me asunder

verses.text_plain: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
verses.verse_html: 13His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

verses.text_plain: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.
verses.verse_html: 14He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

verses.text_plain: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
verses.verse_html: 15I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

verses.text_plain: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
verses.verse_html: 16My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

verses.text_plain: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.
verses.verse_html: 17Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.

verses.text_plain: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
verses.verse_html: 18O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.

verses.text_plain: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
verses.verse_html:
19Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high. ▼
▼ on high: Heb. in the high places

footnotes.body_text: ▼ on high: Heb. in the high places
footnotes.body_html: ▼ on high: Heb. in the high places

verses.text_plain: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
verses.verse_html:
20My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God. ▼
▼ scorn me: Heb. are my scorners

footnotes.body_text: ▼ scorn me: Heb. are my scorners
footnotes.body_html: ▼ scorn me: Heb. are my scorners

verses.text_plain: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!
verses.verse_html:
21O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour! ▼
▼ neighbour: or, friend

verses.text_plain: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
verses.verse_html:
22When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return. ▼
▼ a few…: Heb. years of number

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a few…: Heb. years of number
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a few…: Heb. years of number
